instance.description: Trace the path(s) for the specified flow.
instance.longDescription:
This question performs a virtual traceroute in the network from a starting node. A destination IP and ingress (source) node must be specified. Other IP headers are given default values if unspecified.
Unlike a real traceroute, this traceroute is directional. That is, for it to succeed, the reverse connectivity is not needed. This feature can help debug connectivity issues by decoupling the two directions.

dscp.description: Applied Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value in IP header

dstProtocol.description: Destination named protocol (can affect IP protocol number; ICMP type/code; TCP/UDP destination port)

ecn.description: Applied Explicit Congestion Notification (ECN) value in TCP header

fragmentOffset.description: Fragment offset value in IP header

ignoreAcls.description: If set to True, ACLs encountered along the path are ignored

ipProtocol.description: IP Protocol number in IP header

srcIpSpace.description: Specification of source IP address in IP header

srcProtocol.description: Source named protocol (can affect IP protocol number; ICMP type/code; TCP/UDP source port)

state.description: Non-transitive stateful-firewall state (applies to all protocols, and is independent of TCP flags)

tcpAck.description: ACK bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpCwr.description: CWR bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpEce.description: ECE bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpFin.description: FIN bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpPsh.description: PSH bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpRst.description: RST bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpSyn.description: SYN bit in TCP flags in TCP header

tcpUrg.description: URG bit in TCP flags in TCP header

traceStart.description: Location (node and interface combination) to start tracing from
